column4: I uninstalled BOINC but the Project I added is still running at startup, and it's not under the System->Administration-> Startup Applications
Try running ps ax | egrep -i enigma and pastebin the result...
$ ps ax | egrep -i enigma:
good. Now run 'egrep -i enigma /etc/init.d/*' and see if you get any hits...
http://paste.ubuntu.com/384743/
ok, that means it's not started from /etc/init.d. You're going to have to search for it. How large is the disk?
Default Wubi install is ~25GB
I opened the File Manager and searched it in there. It shows some files but not the file that's under System Monitor
try running 'find / -xdev | egrep -i enigma' and see if locates the binary
Found it.
where?
/var/lib/boinc-client/........
There's more subfolders
Can I just delete the 'boinc-client' folder since it's not installed anymore?
someone said the client was probably still around. Try apt-get remove boinc-client first
Wow thanks, it is. I uninstalled it through Software Center yesterday though....
lazy programmers don't clean up after themselves...
Thanks for the advice. Removing it through apt actually killed the process too
ah, the small victories....

Okay, I would greatly appreciate one more issue I need help with. Under System Monitor, there are like a bazillion Sleeping processes open that are not visible (as in, they're running in the background). Are all of these necessary, or can I stop them from starting at system startup?
usually you can get rid of some of them. There are web pages on it I seem to recall. And a program called 'bum' (boot up manager). Do a bit of googling...
